pr_title: [typescript-angular] support for object query parameters as nested key/json string

timeline.author: amakhrov

replies.bodyText:
Yes, open to an alternative if there is one for passing into mustache template:
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/5790/files#diff-f61af8a4c4eb2720bfb15259e0dca419R170-R187
EDIT: FYI, I'm just making a guess at how to implement.
replies.author: dougal83

replies.bodyText: I mean the actual java constants: QUERY_PARAM_OBJECT_FORMAT_KEY, QUERY_PARAM_OBJECT_FORMAT_JSON, QUERY_PARAM_OBJECT_FORMAT_DOT - they are defined here, but I can't see any code that refers to them. Am I missing the point?
replies.author: amakhrov

replies.bodyText:
I think it's that I don't understand Java, I was just muddling through.  After adding these the mustache template seemed to pick up the values (or it was a coincidence).
I'll remove and put down to coincidence if it works.  Thanks for pointing ti out as it was pretty ugly.
replies.author: dougal83

timeline.author: amakhrov

timeline.bodyText: Suggest using enum instead of hardcoded strings. See e.g. MODEL_PROPERTY_NAMING_TYPE
timeline.author: amakhrov

replies.bodyText: Would the enum constant go with MODEL_PROPERTY_NAMING_TYPE in the same global file or be held locally?  (I'll do the later for now)
replies.author: dougal83

replies.bodyText: I believe it should be defined locally, as it's very specific to the angular generator.
replies.author: amakhrov

replies.bodyText:
Thanks.  One more query if you don't mind!  If this.queryParamObjectFormat is an enum then how do we approach the following?  It was a string but with enum we need a bit more, or shall I just omit the CLI option?
this.cliOptions.add(new CliOption( // ... )
.defaultValue(this.queryParamObjectFormat));

Would .toString() be satisfactory?
replies.author: dougal83

replies.bodyText:
.defaultValue(this.queryParamObjectFormat.name())
you could refer to how MODEL_PROPERTY_NAMING and ENUM_PROPERTY_NAMING are used inside AbstractTypeScriptClientCodegen
replies.author: amakhrov

replies.bodyText: @amakhrov Thank you for the guidance.  Applied feedback.
replies.author: dougal83

timeline.message:
add query param object format options
